content: कक्षः {@--1@} A lurking or hidingplace. {@--2@} The end of the lower garment; see कक्षा. {@--3@} A climbing plant, creeper. {@--4@} Grass, dry grass; यतस्तु कक्षस्तत एव वह्निः <ls>R. 7. 55</ls>, <ls n="R.">11. 75</ls>; <ls>Ms. 7. 110.</ls> {@--5@} A forest of dead trees, dry wood. {@--6@} The arm-pit; °अंतर <ls>Pt. 1.</ls> the cavity of the armpit; प्रक्षिप्योदर्चिषं कक्षे शेरते तेऽ भिमारुतं <ls>Śi. 2. 42.</ls> {@--7@} The harem of a king. {@--8@} The interior of a forest; आश् निर्गत्य कक्षात् <ls>Rs. 1. 27</ls>; कक्षांतरगतो वायुः <ls>Rām.</ls> {@--9@} The side or flank (of anything). {@--10@} A woman's girdle; as in आबद्धनिबिडकक्षैः. {@--11@} A surrounding wall. {@--12@} A part of a boat. {@--13@} The orbit of a planet. {@--14@} A buffalo. {@--15@} A gate. {@--16@} The Beleric Myrobalan or Terminalia Belerica. {@--17@} A marshy ground. --क्षा {@--1@} Painful boils in the arm-pit. {@--2@} An elephant's rope; also his girth. {@--3@} A woman's girdle or zone; a girdle, waist-band (in general); <ls>Śi. 17. 24.</ls> {@--4@} A surrounding wall; a wall. {@--5@} The waist, middle part; <ls>Mk. 5. 21.</ls> {@--6@} A courtyard; area. {@--7@} An enclosure. {@--8@} An inner apartment, a private chamber: room in general; <ls>Ku. 7. 70</ls>; <ls>Ms. 7. 224</ls>; गृहकलहंसकाननुसरन् कक्षांतरप्रधावितः <ls>K. 63</ls>, <ls n="K.">182.</ls> {@--9@} A harem. {@--10@} Similarity. {@--11@} An upper garment. {@--12@} Objection or reply in argument (in Logic &c.). {@--13@} Emulation or rivalry. {@--14@} A secluded part of an edifice. {@--15@} A particular part of a carriage. {@--16@} The jeweller's weight, {%Retti%}. {@--17@} The end of the lower garment which, after the cloth is girt round the lower part of the body, is brought up behind and tucked into the waistband (<ab>Mar.</ab> कांसोटा). {@--18@} Tying up the waist. {@--19@} The wrist. {@--20@} Border or lace. {@--21@} The basin of a balance (कक्षः also). --क्षं {@--1@} A star. {@--2@} Sin.
